title: Questions about tree shap paper
body:
Hi Scott, I really enjoy reading your SHAP and Tree SHAP paper. I've been trying to understand the Algorithm2 in the Tree SHAP paper, but still cannot understand how it works.

I can understand that the `RECURSE` procedure does a depth-first traversal, and in each call it passes down the proportion of "zeros" and "ones" paths reaching the node. If I get it right, when reaching a leaf node, the `sum(UNWIND(..))` part in Algorithm2 is calculating the contribution to phi_i from that leaf node. Specifically it "compress" all the weighting information (the factorial term, the term relating to proportion of paths reaching that leaf with or without feature i for all subset) of calculating expectation into m.w, but I cannot figure out how m.w achieves this.

Can you shed some light on how algorithm 2 works, especially about the intuition behind `m.w` and how&why `m.w` is updated in `EXTEND` and `UNWIND`?

Thank you!
